selected_quotes: Just a few pages into Elke D'Hoker's Irish Women Writers the Modern Short Story -learned so much already!
Thanks @glucksman for having this great new book in stock already! Hot off the (digital) press! @UL_Research #irishstud…
Thanks @ULLibrary for having this great new book in stock already! Hot off the (digital) press! @UL_Research #irishstud…
Elke D'Hoker is fantastic. I quoted her brilliant 'Half-man, half-doll' on George Egerton Nietzsche at a conference on Sat. Wonderful!
The first book dedicated solely to the short fiction of Irish women writers

facebook.title: Irish Women Writers and the Modern Short Story | Elke D'hoker | Palgrave Macmillan
facebook.summary:
Elke D’hoker, Irish Women Writers and the Modern Short Story (Palgrave Macmillan, 2016)
 

This book traces the development of the modern short story in the hands of Irish women writers from the 1890s to the present. George Egerton, Somerville and Ross, El
